comment: compared to Junie using same models, generated code is awful. Lots of halluzinated code, there are no follow-up questions, context window seems to be small - forgets previous questions fast. missing many new models. Many false and buggy suggestions.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Since October I can't login on my Lenovo IDEAPAD Slim 5x with Snapdragon ARM, I tried the plugin with Jetbrains IDEA IntelliJ Community and Webstorm, I tried to log out and login from Jetbrains products, I tried to Uninstall/Reinstall, Come back to previous versions of September and October of IntelliJ and the plugin, Follow this article but nothing works for me :( https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/28905779477394--Bug-Copilot-stuck-at-Retrieving-GitHub-Device-Code-in-IntelliJ-regression-in-1-5-53-243 Maybe helpful remarks :

  • Pending Retrieving Github Device Code
  • When click on Sign in for Github Copilot : Dialog with Github Copilot Failed to initiate the GitHub login process. Please try again.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: When can I use gemini3 on JetBrains

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Full of artificial limitations and bugs not present in the VS Code version. Feels like a plugin for 2nd-class customers.

  • Delayed support for new models (supposedly improving, but still frustrating)
  • Agent tool call limitations not present in VS Code (settings artificially capped at 100), pressing Continue consumes another Premium Request (vs. no cost in VS Code)
  • Persistent bugs where Copilot Agent is unable to read terminal output or thinks it's empty, thinks files are empty and overwrites them, sees outdated versions of files, etc.
  • Recent bug where Chat just resets mid-conversation, consumes a premium request and starts working, but suddenly, poof!, back to scratch, no chat history, half-finished changes
  • Instruction following and context compression is far worse than VS Code or CLI, runs out of context much faster given same instructions, ignores simple commands like not to generate documents (same setup works fine on other versions)
  • Not open source so we can't even tell and properly debug what's going wrong with it

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It’s hard to believe that a plugin built by a billion-dollar company has such poor quality in both usability and the overall UX/UI experience, especially compared to what they offer in VS Code. The only explanation I can think of is a conflict of interest since the same company owns a competing IDE. There has to be a better way to improve both the user experience and the agentic capabilities. Windsurf has done a great job bringing the same set of features from VS Code into IntelliJ, so it’s definitely possible.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The latest model support arrives far too late.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I have to say, that I am surprised at the amount of negative reviews still posted here! Although I believe them, I can say that this plugin has improved drastically since I started using it, and I am not faced with as much as issues as I had before, and I am pleased to report a smoother experience. Keep it up devs!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: There are no current models, such as the Gemeni 3. It often fails to read a file on the first try. It often doesn't see terminal output during a session, saying the output is empty. It often implements mandatory instruction rules. This same plugin, but in VS Code, works much better.

comment:
I don't care about yours instruction "close review window and report a bug" because it creatures don't care about our reports. So my report will be here. Copilot just stops working with a bug about "initialization". You see, that bastards uses terminal in DataGrip, which I removed by some mistake (another bug) with sync between two instances DataGrip. Thus it keeps silent in UI about problem with "initialization".
I would to see developers this plugin in the hell. Because IT'S PAID software. I paid money and should guessing about your broken brains and decisions instead of seeing notification "terminal plugin required". You're really "viber codes".

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Guys, don't sweat these comments. I've compared multiple code AI Agents, and after using this plugin for over a year, I'm still sticking with it.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I love it guys keep it up! Don't get to hung up on all the negative reviews!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
This extension is so vital and yet absolutely terrible:

  • the new LLMs take weeks to be added
  • files get modified/corrupted in agentic mode without me ever approving the changes
  • the agent asks to run the tests through bash console (and not using existing run configurations, that is integration with native IDE tools is absent) before I even confirmed the changes it suggests (doesn't make sense to test something before it exists)
  • occasionally the plugin stops responding and consumes a lot of CPU (at least in the past, nowadays it's a bit more stable)

comment: Breaks constantly, seems to happen after every update. Previously, uninstalling and reinstalling fixed, but now I can't get it working at all.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I really wish vscode wasn't so bad as an IDE because this extension is so behind it's no longer even funny. It's one step forward two steps backwards every single time and I'm really tired of you pretending to treat Jetbrains ecosystem seriously

You claim that your pipeline for model support has improved and it only takes 7 days on average for you to implement given model. Considering Opus 3.5 is only available on lower pricing till December 5th that means the users of this plugin are robbed of the option because you will only add is after the price increase. Not cool.

It's so bad it feels intentional. Sometimes I can't open a chat session. It deletes files that should not be deleted. It ask permission every time when it should use terminal. Sometimes it can't see output of it's own terminal commands.

Absolutely all models perform worse then same used from original provider.

comment:
In a serious violation of free and fair trade Microsoft seem to have killed MPC integration to copilot on Intelij IDEs - it's even more clear they are pushing VS code as the primary venue for copilot

I'll be leaving copilot due to this and trying continue dev with my own API keys. Real shame, I did enjoy using it but this is unacceptable. I would prefer to use Junie, but as it's blocked in my location I also have no choice

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
its basically as bad as people say - you need to learn to use it in a way to avoid the bugs and problems. I think its powerful but buggy. I like jetbrains more than VS, so i feel a bit stuck with it - really hoping that they make a breakthrough at some point and make it more robust and user friendly.

I find it good enough, but i think i'm being very charitable in saying that.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I’ve run into a lot of bugs, and it’s been pretty difficult to use. Using it through VS Code has been a much smoother experience. It still feels unfinished, for example, the /clear command hasn’t worked for months, which makes it seem like the team might not be testing it regularly. I really hope it gets some attention soon, because right now it’s frustrating to work with.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Latest Rider - 2025.3.0.1, latest plugin - 1.5.61-243. 2 exceptions on IDE start and frozen chat window. Does anyone test this plugin?

UPD: Looks like, you guys cannot say what your plugin depends on and just throw exception, right? I'll help you: git (which JetBrains are in progress of killing - IJPL-177161) and Terminal (which is awful IMHO). Please, check your dependencies and a) don't depend on what is not absolutely necessary and b) if some dependency is not enabled, only the part of your plugin that ultimately depends on it should gracefully stop working. It's more like work of 2-nd grade students, not a big company.
